intro: Aspidogyne gavilanensis, commonly known as the Gavilanensis aspidogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
